intro: Hoffmannia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hoffmannia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Hoffmannia angustifolia is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
